intro: Helenium vernale, commonly known as the early sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow to orange petals. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowering period occurs in early summer, making it a valuable early-season nectar source for pollinators. Helenium vernale is often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks.
